title: Trailblazer League/Guide

properties.name: description
properties.value: Trailblazer League presents unique decisions and challenges unlike most content in Old School RuneScape. Since players are restricted to just 5 of the 9 available areas, sacrifices will have to be made when it comes to training skills and making money. This guide aims to provide information about the league mechanics, different training methods, and money making guides based on the constraints within the league.

content:
Trailblazer League
Guides

Trailblazer League presents unique decisions and challenges unlike most content in Old School RuneScape. Since players are restricted to just 5 of the 9 available areas, sacrifices will have to be made when it comes to training skills and making money. This guide aims to provide information about the league mechanics, different training methods, and money making guides based on the constraints within the league.

Contents

  • 1 Getting started
  • 2 Relics
  • 3 Tasks
  • 4 Skill training
  • 5 Quests
  • 6 Money making
  • 7 Getting around
  • 8 Items
    • 8.1 Notable unobtainable items

Getting started[edit | edit source]

The initial spawn location is at the Lumbridge Castle, which has a number of opportunities for low-level training. For example, nearby Men and Women can be pickpocketed for Thieving training, and Trees can be cut down to train Woodcutting. Just south-east of Lumbridge Castle is the Lumbridge Swamp, which has a beginner's mine and Fishing spots. Lumbridge is home to some of the first quests available in the League, including Cook's Assistant, Sheep Shearer, and Misthalin Mystery. These three quests reward the player with a nice boost to the Cooking and Crafting skills, which is nice to get early on.

The Misthalin✓ and Karamja✓ areas are unlocked for free, additional areas can be unlocked by completing Tasks.

Moving on, it is up to the player what path they choose to take. This will depend on personal preference, as well as any Relic and Area choices they have made.

Relics[edit | edit source]

Main article: Trailblazer League/Relics

Relics are powerful buffs that are unlocked with League Points. Upon completing the tutorial, players are presented with three Relics to choose from without the need for points. There are six tiers of relics in total, as well as an additional passive buff automatically unlocked at each tier. Each tier corresponds to a different aspect of the game: skilling, teleportation, combat, and utility.

Once players choose a Relic of a tier, they will be permanently unlocked, but cannot change their Relic selection for that tier.

Relic tiers will fall into the following tiers, each with a passive unlock for all players who reach that tier:

Passive Relic effects and Relic Categories
Tier 1 2 3 4 5 6
Passive Run Energy will
never drain
while running 		League XP multiplier
increased from
5x to 8x 		Drop rate modifier
increased from
1x to 2x 		League XP multiplier
increased from
8x to 12x 		Drop rate modifier
increased from
2x to 3x 		League XP multiplier
increased from
12x to 16x
Relic Category Skilling Teleportation Combat Utility Skilling Combat
Points required 0 500 2,000 4,000 7,500 15,000

Tasks[edit | edit source]

Main article: Trailblazer League/Tasks

Tasks in the Trailblazer League will function quite similarly to those of the Twisted League, awarding points for both small and large achievements. Tasks will be either global (unlockable in any region) or regional (requiring a player choice to unlock, besides for Misthalin✓ or Karamja✓). As before, league points will be used to unlock relics upon reaching a certain threshold (the points will be kept).

Unique to this league, tasks will also be used to reach regional unlocks, requiring 60, 140, and 300 task completions to unlock a third, fourth, and fifth region, respectively. Players should plan carefully early on to keep a focus both on completing more difficult tasks to gain relics, as well as a good number easier tasks to unlock more areas. As an alternative, focusing solely on points to unlock relics quickly or completing tasks to unlock more regions are viable strategies as well.

In the Trailblazer League, tasks will be more focused on actions you can complete or monster drops than on skilling thresholds reached or boss kill count. Instead of a sequence of tasks such as "Kill Sarachnis 25/50/75/100 Times" or "Reach 50m/100m/200m Firemaking experience, players should expect more tasks focused on loot drops (as the drop rate is buffed by relic tiers) and a cap on tasks for skilling experience at 25 million. This means players are more likely to succeed focusing on a variety of activities, rather than finding a single fast method and camping out in a particular area.

The points awarded for each difficulty level are as follows:

Difficulty Points
Easy 10
Medium 50
Hard 100
Elite 250
Master 500

Skill training[edit | edit source]

Main article: Trailblazer League/Guide/Skills

Training Skills in Trailblazer League can be very similar to that of regular ironman accounts, depending on what combination of areas are chosen as unlocks. Players will begin with level 3 herblore, 5 runecraft, and level 10 agility to enable herblore training, runecraft training, and the use of the Draynor Village rooftop agility course.

Experience received for training any skill will be multiplied by 5x the usual rate. By unlocking relic tiers 2, 4, and 6, this multiplier can be increased to 8x, 12x, and 16x, respectively.

See the following guides for training each skill:

  • Agility
  • Construction
  • Cooking
  • Crafting
  • Farming
  • Firemaking
  • Fishing
  • Fletching
  • Herblore
  • Hunter
  • Magic
  • Melee
  • Mining
  • Prayer
  • Ranged
  • Runecraft
  • Slayer
  • Smithing
  • Thieving
  • Woodcutting

Quests[edit | edit source]

Main article: Trailblazer League/Guide/Quests

Due to the area-restricted nature of the Trailblazer League, many quests which require multiple areas to complete will be unlocked automatically as the player unlocks new regions, allowing immediate access to much of a region's key content. Other quests will be completable within a certain combination of regions but not others, while some quests will be impossible to complete, requiring four or more unlockable regions to reach all locations or collect all the items needed.

Quest experience rewards will be multiplied with the same multiplier as other experience gains. Auto-unlocked quests will not reward experience. However, if the player completes a quest before it is auto-unlocked, they will receive the rewards for that quest.

Money making[edit | edit source]

Main article: Trailblazer League/Guide/Money Making

Coins are useful for many things within Trailblazer League such as buying runes and ammunition from shops, planks and other construction materials from sawmills and tanning hides with a Tanner.

Depending on the region selection (or combination of regions), there may be more expensive choices available as well, such as a dragon scimitar from Daga's Scimitar Smithy or a Dwarf cannon if Kandarin✓ and Asgarnia✓ are both taken. Imbuing equipment at the Nightmare Zone (points will be available at a cost of 1 coin each) will be available after taking Kandarin✓ and a region with imbuable items (such as Fremennik✓ or Morytania✓). Players in Tirannwn✓ will need 900,000 coins or 78 smithing, 78 crafting and 40 crystal shards to buy or create a new Crystal bow, due to Roving elves being autocompleted.

Getting around[edit | edit source]

Main article: Trailblazer League/Getting Around

Every player begins the league with the passive relic effect of infinite run energy. Once an area is unlocked, players will be able to teleport to a predetermined spot in the region, with no cooldown. Access to teleportation methods within a locked region are unavailable.

The Fairytale II quest is automatically completed and the Leagues Tutor will provide a dramen staff, granting the ability to use fairy rings.

The second tier of relics are centred around teleportation.

Items[edit | edit source]

Similar to quests, access to many items will be heavily restricted based on region choices. Some items will be obtainable only through unlocking multiple regions. The Slayer helmet, for example, will only be available with Morytania✓ unlocked. Unlocking Kandarin✓ as well will allow the player to imbue it into the Slayer Helm (i).

Other items, such as Barrows gloves will be completely unobtainable without unlocking more regions than are available. Be sure to check area and skill guides to ensure that you do not lose access to items you may need, or aren't picking a region for an item that will not be available.

Notable unobtainable items[edit | edit source]

This is a list of useful non-obvious items which are unable to be obtained due to requiring more than three region unlocks or disabled content.

Item Notes
Barrows gloves To fully complete Recipe for Disaster a player would be required to unlock Desert (Evil Dave), Fremennik (Sir Amik Varze), Asgarnia, and Kandarin.
Dragon gloves To complete 8 Recipe for Disaster subquests a player would be required to unlock Desert (Evil Dave), Fremennik (Sir Amik Varze), Asgarnia, and Kandarin.
Quest cape There is no way to complete every quest in the Trailblazer League, and thus no way to obtain this cape.
Achievement cape There is no way to complete every diary in the Trailblazer League, and thus no way to obtain this cape.
Proselyte armour The Slug menace quest cannot be completed and is not auto-unlocked.

{{TBL Guide Links}} Trailblazer League presents unique decisions and challenges unlike most content in Old School RuneScape. Since players are restricted to just 5 of the 9 available areas, sacrifices will have to be made when it comes to training skills and making money. This guide aims to provide information about the league mechanics, different training methods, and money making guides based on the constraints within the league. ==Getting started== The initial spawn location is at the [[Lumbridge Castle]], which has a number of opportunities for low-level training. For example, nearby [[Man|Men]] and [[Woman|Women]] can be pickpocketed for Thieving training, and [[Trees]] can be cut down to train Woodcutting. Just south-east of Lumbridge Castle is the [[Lumbridge Swamp]], which has a beginner's [[East Lumbridge Swamp mine|mine]] and [[Fishing spots]]. [[Lumbridge]] is home to some of the first [[Trailblazer League/Guide/Quests|quests]] available in the League, including [[Cook's Assistant]], [[Sheep Shearer]], and [[Misthalin Mystery]]. These three quests reward the player with a nice boost to the [[Cooking]] and [[Crafting]] skills, which is nice to get early on. The {{TB|Misthalin}} and {{TB|Karamja}} areas are unlocked for free, additional areas can be unlocked by completing [[Trailblazer League/Tasks|Tasks]]. Moving on, it is up to the player what path they choose to take. This will depend on personal preference, as well as any [[Trailblazer League/Relics|Relic]] and [[Trailblazer League/Areas|Area]] choices they have made. ==Relics== {{Main|Trailblazer League/Relics}} Relics are powerful buffs that are unlocked with League Points. Upon completing the tutorial, players are presented with three Relics to choose from without the need for points. There are six tiers of relics in total, as well as an additional passive buff automatically unlocked at each tier. Each tier corresponds to a different aspect of the game: skilling, teleportation, combat, and utility. Once players choose a Relic of a tier, they will be permanently unlocked, but cannot change their Relic selection for that tier. Tasks will be either global (unlockable in any region) or regional (requiring a player choice to unlock, besides for {{TB|Misthalin}} or {{TB|Karamja}}). As before, league points will be used to unlock relics upon reaching a certain threshold (the points will be kept). Unique to this league, tasks will also be used to reach regional unlocks, requiring 60, 140, and 300 task completions to unlock a third, fourth, and fifth region, respectively. Players should plan carefully early on to keep a focus both on completing more difficult tasks to gain relics, as well as a good number easier tasks to unlock more areas. As an alternative, focusing solely on points to unlock relics quickly or completing tasks to unlock more regions are viable strategies as well. In the Trailblazer League, tasks will be more focused on actions you can complete or monster drops than on skilling thresholds reached or boss kill count. Instead of a sequence of tasks such as "Kill Sarachnis 25/50/75/100 Times" or "Reach 50m/100m/200m [[Firemaking]] experience, players should expect more tasks focused on loot drops (as the drop rate is buffed by relic tiers) and a cap on tasks for skilling experience at 25 million. This means players are more likely to succeed focusing on a variety of activities, rather than finding a single fast method and camping out in a particular area. The points awarded for each difficulty level are as follows: {| class="wikitable" |- ! Difficulty !! Points |- | Easy || 10 |- | Medium || 50 |- | Hard || 100 |- | Elite || 250 |- | Master || 500 |} ==Skill training== {{Main|Trailblazer League/Guide/Skills}} Training [[Skills]] in Trailblazer League can be very similar to that of regular ironman accounts, depending on what combination of areas are chosen as unlocks. Players will begin with level 3 herblore, 5 runecraft, and level 10 agility to enable herblore training, runecraft training, and the use of the Draynor Village rooftop agility course. Experience received for training any skill will be multiplied by 5x the usual rate. By unlocking relic tiers 2, 4, and 6, this multiplier can be increased to 8x, 12x, and 16x, respectively. See the following guides for training each skill: * {{plink|Trailblazer League/Guide/Agility|pic=Agility icon|txt=Agility}} * {{plink|Trailblazer League/Guide/Construction|pic=Construction icon|txt=Construction}} * {{plink|Trailblazer League/Guide/Cooking|pic=Cooking icon|txt=Cooking}} * {{plink|Trailblazer League/Guide/Crafting|pic=Crafting icon|txt=Crafting}} * {{plink|Trailblazer League/Guide/Farming|pic=Farming icon|txt=Farming}} * {{plink|Trailblazer League/Guide/Firemaking|pic=Firemaking icon|txt=Firemaking}} * {{plink|Trailblazer League/Guide/Fishing|pic=Fishing icon|txt=Fishing}} * {{plink|Trailblazer League/Guide/Fletching|pic=Fletching icon|txt=Fletching}} * {{plink|Trailblazer League/Guide/Herblore|pic=Herblore icon|txt=Herblore}} * {{plink|Trailblazer League/Guide/Hunter|pic=Hunter icon|txt=Hunter}} * {{plink|Trailblazer League/Guide/Magic|pic=Magic icon|txt=Magic}} * {{plink|Trailblazer League/Guide/Melee|pic=Melee|txt=Melee}} * {{plink|Trailblazer League/Guide/Mining|pic=Mining icon|txt=Mining}} * {{plink|Trailblazer League/Guide/Prayer|pic=Prayer icon|txt=Prayer}} * {{plink|Trailblazer League/Guide/Ranged|pic=Ranged icon|txt=Ranged}} * {{plink|Trailblazer League/Guide/Runecraft|pic=Runecraft icon|txt=Runecraft}} * {{plink|Trailblazer League/Guide/Slayer|pic=Slayer icon|txt=Slayer}} * {{plink|Trailblazer League/Guide/Smithing|pic=Smithing icon|txt=Smithing}} * {{plink|Trailblazer League/Guide/Thieving|pic=Thieving icon|txt=Thieving}} * {{plink|Trailblazer League/Guide/Woodcutting|pic=Woodcutting icon|txt=Woodcutting}} ==Quests== {{Main|Trailblazer League/Guide/Quests}} Due to the area-restricted nature of the Trailblazer League, many quests which require multiple areas to complete will be unlocked automatically as the player unlocks new regions, allowing immediate access to much of a region's key content. Other quests will be completable within a certain combination of regions but not others, while some quests will be impossible to complete, requiring four or more unlockable regions to reach all locations or collect all the items needed. Quest experience rewards will be multiplied with the same multiplier as other experience gains. Auto-unlocked quests will not reward experience. However, if the player completes a quest before it is auto-unlocked, they will receive the rewards for that quest. ==Money making== {{Main|Trailblazer League/Guide/Money Making}} [[Coins]] are useful for many things within [[Trailblazer League]] such as buying [[runes]] and [[ammunition]] from shops, [[planks]] and other construction materials from [[sawmill]]s and tanning hides with a [[Tanner]]. Depending on the region selection (or combination of regions), there may be more expensive choices available as well, such as a [[dragon scimitar]] from [[Daga's Scimitar Smithy]] or a [[Dwarf cannon]] if {{TB|Kandarin}} and {{TB|Asgarnia}} are both taken. Imbuing equipment at the [[Nightmare Zone]] (points will be available at a cost of 1 coin each) will be available after taking {{TB|Kandarin}} and a region with imbuable items (such as {{TB|Fremennik}} or {{TB|Morytania}}). Players in {{TB|Tirannwn}} will need 900,000 coins or 78 smithing, 78 crafting and 40 crystal shards to buy or create a new [[Crystal bow]], due to [[Roving elves]] being autocompleted. ==Getting around== {{Main|Trailblazer League/Getting Around}} Every player begins the league with the passive relic effect of infinite [[run energy]]. Once an area is unlocked, players will be able to teleport to a predetermined spot in the region, with no cooldown. Access to teleportation methods within a locked region are unavailable. The [[Fairytale II - Cure a Queen|Fairytale II]] quest is automatically completed and the [[Leagues Tutor]] will provide a [[dramen staff]], granting the ability to use [[fairy rings]]. The second tier of relics are centred around teleportation. ==Items== Similar to quests, access to many items will be heavily restricted based on region choices. Some items will be obtainable only through unlocking multiple regions. The [[Slayer helmet]], for example, will only be available with {{TB|Morytania}} unlocked. Unlocking {{TB|Kandarin}} as well will allow the player to imbue it into the [[Slayer helmet (i) |Slayer Helm (i)]]. Other items, such as [[Barrows gloves]] will be completely unobtainable without unlocking more regions than are available. Be sure to check area and skill guides to ensure that you do not lose access to items you may need, or aren't picking a region for an item that will not be available. ===Notable unobtainable items=== This is a list of useful non-obvious items which are unable to be obtained due to requiring more than three region unlocks or disabled content. {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! colspan=2 | Item !! Notes |- | align=center | {{plinkp|Barrows gloves}} || [[Barrows gloves]] || To fully complete [[Recipe for Disaster]] a player would be required to unlock Desert (Evil Dave), Fremennik (Sir Amik Varze), Asgarnia, and Kandarin. |- | align=center | {{plinkp|Dragon gloves}} || [[Dragon gloves]] || To complete 8 [[Recipe for Disaster]] subquests a player would be required to unlock Desert (Evil Dave), Fremennik (Sir Amik Varze), Asgarnia, and Kandarin. |- | align=center | {{plinkp|Quest point cape}} || [[Quest cape]] || There is no way to complete every quest in the [[Trailblazer League]], and thus no way to obtain this cape. |- | align=center | {{plinkp|Achievement diary cape}} || [[Achievement cape]] || There is no way to complete every diary in the [[Trailblazer League]], and thus no way to obtain this cape. |- | align=center | {{plinkp|Proselyte sallet}} || [[Proselyte armour]] || The [[Slug menace]] quest cannot be completed and is not auto-unlocked. |} {{Reflist}} {{Trailblazer League}}
